timeline.message: Fix(AlertPagedModel): Begin refactoring in preperation for paging support
Refactor(JobAccessor): Split out job-related methods from ConfigurationAccessor to JobAccessor
Feat(JobAccessor): Implement paged query for jobs
Feat(JobConfigActions): Add validation to job paged request
Fix(JobConfigController): Add basic interface for paging with controllers and remove getAll endpoint
Fix(JobAccessor): Update job query to account for descriptor permissions
Add FIXMEs for things that require paging
Feat(UI): Add paging to jobs table

timeline.author: gkillough
gkillough

timeline.author: gkillough

timeline.message: Fix(Paging): Clean up some TODOs and FIXMEs
Fix(Jobs): Change job table validation to only validate jobs being displayed (instead of all jobs)
Fix(Job Validation): Add new query to make job-name-uniqueness check more efficient
Fix(JobConfigActions): Remove FIXME comment that was already resolved

timeline.bodyText:
By the name of this I thought this was the validation result of the jobs.  Can we make a slight change to make it clear this is to be used with a request.
For example: JobsIdsValidationRequestModel
timeline.author: psantos1113

timeline.message: Refactor(Job Model): Rename model to include 'response' in its name

timeline.bodyText: isn't 10 a little low? I feel we should be able to get at least 100 items a page rather quickly
timeline.author: bamandel

replies.bodyText: The client of the API can override this, but 10 is the default for audit entries and Black Duck API pages, so I was trying to key off of that.
replies.author: gkillough

timeline.bodyText: Should we be using the jetbrains nullable?
timeline.author: bamandel

replies.bodyText: Good catch. This change was made before that decision.
replies.author: gkillough

timeline.message: Refactor(Annotation): Use JetBrains Nullable to conform to convention

timeline.bodyText: Are these for the next major version? Since people are using our API, won't this break things for them?
timeline.author: bamandel

replies.bodyText: We have swagger documentation of endpoints, but we make it explicitly clear that these endpoints are not considered stable.
replies.author: gkillough
